resources.string: Practical and easy to use contraction timer for your happiest day.
Measure contractions and intervals with a single tap of button.
Storky will let you know when to consider going to the hospital or a birth center.
Try baby monitor created by experts
Get ready for the baby’s arrival with the most reliable baby monitor on the market. Download Bibino now and try it yourself for free.
Get guide how to measure contractions
Would you like to learn how to properly measure the contractions? Enter your email, and we will send a printable how-to guide right into your inbox.
Enter a correct email address and try it again.
Are you sure to skip this step?
Skip this step only if you\'re 100% sure how to measure the contractions properly.
We’ve sent you a message. Confirm your email address, so Storky can send you the contraction records. If you haven’t received the email, check the SPAM folder.
Check out some useful info to better understand all about contractions.
Are you sure you want to start new monitoring? The current one will be stored in History.
Start monitoring your contracitons to see monitoring history here.
Are you sure you want to reset this data?
Are you sure you want to reset all the previous data?
Are you sure you want to clear this contraction?
When stork gets pink, you are probably in Active Labour because of conditions below.
Stork is pink which means all the conditions have been met. You are in Active phase of Labour. Consider going to the hospital or birth center.
When indicator lights on it shows you should consider to go to the hospital or birth center. If you are not sure call your healthcare provider.
Default conditions are when last three contractions come every 5 minutes, each lasting 60 seconds. All the values can be changed below.
Always consult your conditions with healthcare provider. You should go to hospital immediatelly in case of:
Green, brown or yellow water when membranes has broken
No contractions for hours when membranes has broken
Strong headache, dizziness or blurred vision
During labour the uterus contracts and moves your baby down. During contraction your abdomen becomes hard.
It\'s a time from the beginning of one contraction to the beginning of the following one. It is the time of duration of the contraction plus rest time after.
Contractions last 30 - 90 seconds. Before you can feel very short and irregular contractions with very low intensity. It is called False Labour or Pre-Labour.

Contractions are mild and last 30 - 45 seconds with 5 to 30 minutes interval in between. The cervix is dilating to 3 cm. Try to relax or sleep. Wait untill the contractions become stronger and longer. It can last for hours if it is your first labour.

Contractions are becoming stronger and last about 45-60 seconds with 3-5 minutes interval in between. The cervix is dilating from 4 to 7 cm. If the contractions comes every 5 minutes or less, and last for a minute or more over an hour it is time to leave for the hospital or birth center. We will notify you about it by this icon:
Contractions are very strong and last 60-90 seconds with interval about 2-3 minutes. The cervix is dilated to 8 - 10 cm. The baby will be probably coming out soon.
The cervix is fully dilated. Contractions last 60 - 90 seconds and your body is pushing your baby out.
Storky was created with ❤️ by Bibino team. Bibino is an award-winning app that’s trusted by more than 2 million parents all over the world. Try it now.
Hello, I used the simple and handy Storky app to measure my contractions. You can see my contractions below.
Hello, I used the simple and handy Storky app to measure my contractions. You can see the evolution of my contractions in the attached pdf file.
